reviews.text: It's ok
Visited in the early evening, just as picturesque as in the daytime. Found this cute kindness rock by one of the benches there! #spotted
Great little viewpoint along the sea wall to stop and take a photo. The lighthouse is very tiny. But its a nice clear view for pictures.

reviews.author_name: Marcus The Fish Whisperer & Volleyball player
reviews.text: There are stairs you can take to go down to take more pictures of Lions Gate Bridge and other beautiful scenery.
Not bad , except I wish the lighthouse was bigger and taller - that’d be more impressive
Lovely place to sit on the banks of the mighty Fraser River!
Very small park that is pretty, generally quite empty as well
Cute little park in quiet secluded neighbourhood
pretty quite spot right on the river. it’s just missing a simple trash can.
Beautiful place for a walk or a quiet picnic...
Beautiful sunset....
So stale

This bridge like all other bridges of Vancouver.
This is very small Bridge.
Just like any other bridge 🌉 in Vancouver, besides moving traffic, they provide shelter for the less fortunate people in the city.

Very warm and festive atmosphere. The personnel is friendly and offers you free samples of pretty much anything you can find throughout the market. Prices are a bit on the higher end but it’s okay considering the that this is a temporal pleasure. A lot of people from Germany!

I wish I could give this market 5 stars as it is quite a scene to see. In fact, at Christmas, IT IS A MUST GO TO with the family or romantic other. It's super expensive but keep in mind, most of the goods are HAND-MADE and sourced in Germany. It is stunning to say the least. The reason for the 3 stars is not because the venue, staff or food (which is TO DIE FOR), but because they seem to fill over capacity to the point you are sometimes shoulder-to-shoulder. Still, I encourage anyone to check it out for some Christmas spirit!
It was freezing cold when we went during christmas. This time around its summer.. and the christmas market wasn't set up. But its always nice to go to waterfront.

Took my nephew this year and had an amazing time. He's 6 years old and thought it was the greatest thing! There's lots fun free stuff for children to do. We had a blast in the arts n crafts igloo. I highly recommend doing the scavenger treasure hunt (we won a free carousal ride!) Also the berry kinder punch is perfect for those who don't drink alcohol! Great affordable event compared to some of the other events we tried in Vancouver

Vancouver Christmas Market...
We went today to Experience what we had been told was a great market for the Season. My impression?
Not that many actual Maker/Sellers.
As many food merchants as Craft Marketeers.
Plus one major retailer - a true German Retail giant. Though entry required at least a half hour line up.
And the displays and Features are fun!
But really, is that service and experience worth such an entrance charge? Yes, the fee does allow entry for multiple days. But is there anything worth returning to?
Well, once is an Experience. And I've had it now.
If your body is not ready for a hard hike don't do it.:)))
You should prepare for the hike else it's gonna hurt you

This was the first attraction we went to in Vancouver. We did the Grouse Grind which was both exhausting and incredible! At the top there was a nice restaurant and you can take a ski lift(for free) to get to the highest point where you can see the great views. They also have an owl show and a bear sanctuary. Definitely one of the best attractions in Vancouver. The staff makes it very safe with lots of covid safety policies.

Such a great experience, probably one of the best spot in Vancouver, a combination of sea view and fresh air from the mountain, hiking, skiing, activities, no mater the season, there is always something to do. Whoever you are, no matter the age you are. After a great skiing session, what could be better than a great coffee and a peaceful sunset ?
See you there ☝🏼
H
Ohh man sunset are awesome from that place .....go after 4 get 50 percent discounts and its worth the travel n money
Always fun to check out, sad about it being closed for now!
I hope they will rereopen soon!
Hope it will be back soon :(

Love the Aquarium
So sad it is closing!😥

The aquarium was amazing!! It can be bit pricey for a regular ticket, but it’s totally worth it. Near the sea wall, parking is available. You will see a variety of fishes, turtles. They also have special shows hosted for general public. Hope it will re-open soon. The coolest thing to watch was the variety of snakes 🐍

This park is just amazing. Come enjoy the park!😊✌🏻
Love Stanley Park during the daytime. Didn't love the parking fees, but there are so many other options other than cars to get out and enjoy this beautiful place. Try using bus, or bike/walk/jog/skate the sea wall.
Love the lighthouse and look out. Beautiful view of Ocean, North Shore, Lions Gate Bridge, and Vancouver.
Love the miniature train, horse drawn carriage & lots of amazing locations for photography.  📸

If I have one complaint about Stanley Park is that it's busy to get out of the park back through downtown. But that is definitely warranted as it is always absolutely beautiful here. The views of Vancouver and all around the park are always stunning and you could literally spend hours here being active or even just relaxing with your family or friends. Such a wonderful Park to visit

Amazing place to visit with family and friends! You can do a lot of fun activities here and you'll surely love the majestic view of the place. Perfect place to watch the sunset and walk around the area. You'll see people walking, riding their bikes and most of them are watching the views. I highly recommend this place to visit!

Welcome to Stanley Park, Vancouver's first, largest, and most beloved urban park!
Stanley Park is a magnificent green oasis in the midst of the urban landscape of Vancouver.
Explore the 400-hectare natural West Coast rainforest and enjoy scenic views of water, mountains, sky, and majestic trees along Stanley Park's famous Seawall. Discover kilometres of trails, beautiful beaches, local wildlife, great eats, natural, cultural and historical landmarks, along with many other adventures. The park offers a wide range of unforgettable experiences for all ages and interests, including Canada’s largest aquarium.
Vancouver parks are open from 6am to 10pm unless otherwise posted, and access to washrooms is available from dusk until dawn.

￼

Getting here

Walk, bike, take transit, or drive — find simple directions, along with maps to find parking, things to do and see, and trails to explore.

￼

Great place to walk, jog, cycling, picnic and hanging out with friends. One of my most favourite park that I have visited till date. Provide you with a great view of ocean, bridge. Have best Aquarium in Vancouver😍

The best mountain out of the local ones here.  I rate this better than grouse and Seymour.  Grouse however is easy to access with their gondola and bus but cypress has the best runs. Cypress is good for the newbie or even the advance. Good for snowboarders and skiers

First time snowboarding in Cypress. Really great experience overall. All staff were kind and helpful especially for us newbies, they even offered tips on the easy rider.
The Crazy Raven bar had the most amazing polar bear hot chocolate 😉

Really great place with lots of hiking spots, nice views and good trails. The scenery is really good, and there is lots of shade. When you get to the end it is really nice. There is lots of parking before the trail. We went as a family and we saw a bear. It was a really great time.

Good snow condition. Really lot of lights for night skiing - new LED lamp working fantastic. But... Unfortunately customer service by phone or email completely not working. We try to reach somebody to ask gor ski lessons, but it impossible.... Even when meet one of manager of customer service on hill, he cannot answer our questions. He said that there is problem to complete crew, and didn't solve our issues. Other Vancouver's resorts are organized much better.

Their website gives an error when you try to purchase. You ask for help and you receive help a week later, they don't pick up their phone calls, or respond to urgent messages.

By the time they reply, the passes were sold out and I have yet to get any assistance regarding that... It has been a month since I tried to buy a family pass and I have gotten nothing.

I was forced to purchase a ticket, with no help.

Place is nice but there is NO ASSISTANCE and NO CUSTOMER SERVICE
Statue just outside the giftshop entrance

A lovely art gallery in downtown Vancouver! They keep the place very clean and open with limited number of visits per day and time slot, making it very safe to visit during COVID. I truly enjoyed my visit here.

Not only is this an incredible Art Gallery always full of fascinating and historic art, but it has a gorgeous brand new area in the front of it off of Georgia.  You can sit relaxe, even lay down on grassy patches, with the incredible lion statues!  It's also a terrific place for groups to gather for their presentations and speeches!

had a great time. lots of different kind of artwork on display. I would've liked to see more modern contemporary art, and paintings. but overall it was really interesting and intellectually stimulating! Tuesdays 5-8pm is admission by donations, $5 or $10, the place may be a little busier but it's a steal of a deal. go check it out!
This is place is awful. A very small collection of the most uninteresting items.  Such a nice building is going to waste.

Beautiful place to visit and things to do year round. So many unique flowers and trees. A little zen paradise nestled in the middle of the city. Family friendly and great for a date night too! Definitely check out the garden maze!
Had a great time walking around and taking in the beauty since the forest fire smoke has taken away the majority of the scenery in Vancouver.

The gardens and the plantlife were absolutely beautiful with plenty of greenery and plants of different varieties, species and colors. It's a very calming and relaxing place to visit with the family or significant other. It's also a very picturesque place with many great photo opportunities for your photo album or social media.

First time to visiting this garden and visiting this light festival. I had a great memory of it. It’s big enough to visit and lots of attractive lights with different styles and types. Anyway, if they could put more effect like big screens of animation would be more attractive~~~

It's a nice park. It's worth visiting. There are so many plants, many plants in many parts of the world, and the design is excellent. When you come to Vancouver, you can recommend it when you have time. You have to clock in every winter. The garden decorated with lights is super beautiful, and it's very suitable to visit with friends and family
Got a tour. Missed the service. Beautiful church. Nice people.
Wonderful acoustics.  Great repertoire and celestial singing voices all the way from Cornell University,  Ithaca,  NY!

This is an open minded and forward thinking congregation. They are warm and friendly and welcoming to all.  Come as you are there's no judgement.  No matter your belief or scepticism...they are happy to meet you.

The stain glass windows alone will bring you joy!
Once the room erupts in song the acoustic pleasure is all yours to enjoy!
Occasionally it holds West coast Symphonic orchestra concerts, that's why I go there

We got here at 2:45, was hoping they would have a reduced rate as we only had an hour in the park. They didn’t and we decided to check it out anyway. With the day rate and parking it’s pretty expensive. However the park is quite nice inside.

They have reasonably sized cages for the animals and they seem well taken care of. It would have been nice to see all of the animals however some were hiding. For the most part we were able to see some pretty neat animals.

I think I would come back in the summer with more time, you can rent bikes or take a train around the park for extra. It’s a fair bit of walking if you don’t choose one of these options.

Overall a fun day and a great way to see some beautiful animals up close!

It’s a very lovely zoo. It’s relatively small compared to those massive fancy ones, but it’s really adorable and I love how active and happy the animals are. They seems to be respected and taken care of. We arrived in the afternoon and some of them are sleeping, but as it approaching dinner time, we did see interesting intersections.

It probably takes 2-3 hours to walk around and finish the zoo, next time I will try to arrive in the early morning to make sure I can get some good photos.

Pretty average for a zoo. The giraffes and large cats were cool but parts of the zoo are a little run down. Still they appear to respect their animals. The staff at spoke with were clearly passionate about their jobs. We were a little surprised about the paid parking given no easy transit options but we had a good time.

It's an alright zoo, but how much you enjoy it will depend on your expectations. If you go in expecting dozens of animals everywhere you go you'll be disappointed. If you go in expecting a relaxing walk with some animals on the side it's a pretty good time.

I went with my girlfriend and we got to see three grizzly bear cubs playing right up against their enclosure, and a hippo pacing around near the viewing gallery.

Overall it was pretty good, but temper your expectations.

We love the zoo. It is a great way to burn off some energy in a very safe environment! The enclosures are always getting better and we enjoy watching the zoo keepers add value to the animals lives with enrichments and affection. We feel the the family pass makes this one of the most cost effective outings to do with our family of five!

Really enjoyed my socially distanced visit with my partner. You have to book a time ahead on their site which was easy to do. We arrived around 11am and were there until about 1.45pm

The reason we initially decided to visit was to see the Vancouver neon exhibit but ended up learning so much more about the local unceded territories and the history of Asian immigration and issues they've ran up against since the 1800's (Seat at the Table).

Highly recommend it and for the price conscious tickets are currently only $10. Seniors and kids price is $5.

The museum of Vancouver is a wealth of information of our cities history. They have a beautiful candid view of our past and do an amazing job displaying things in a fun and educational way.

Staff were so nice and sanitization stations are all over the place. Not only that but they provide styluses of any interactive stations inside so its all hands off!

Lots of space between us and other patrons and we were even lucky enough to enjoy a 30% off sale in the gift shop on our visit.

Amazing location and a great resource for indigenous history and our cities history. Great for homeschooling parents looking for a safe space to learn!

Current exhibits on Chinese immigration in the 20th century, Vancouver's history with neon lights and art and artifacts from the local First Nations were all well outfitted and engaging. There's limited free parking in the surrounded neighbourhoods, but plenty of paid parking out front. Unfortunately it seems like the space wing is closed, possibly due to covid, though there appeared to be social distancing markers on the ground, behind the locked glass doors.

Very interesting exhibitions about Haida Gwaii culture and history and the neon Vancouver signs. Loved the decades history exhibicion as well. A must while viaiting Vancouver. The crab sculpture/fountain alone worths the visit.
A very good place for family and kids. Lots of good exhibitions held there.

It was excellent, all was perfect including the covid restrictions. The manager gave us a solution fast because everyone want to take a table close to the window to has a better view. The service  is excellent and maybe just need little of variety in the menu but all perfect. Thanks
Amazing
Harbour air top shelf service free coffee bar in the secure member only waiting room. Flight is so quick and beautiful. And your in the city in 20 mins not 3 or 4 hours with the ferry

Not much here really,tho highly reccomend Booster Juice for exellent health drinks.
:D
Great place to relax have a bite to eat and excellent security staff

This is a fascinating museum with great tour guides. Tours are free and you should definitely time your visit so you can go on one. It's on the smallish side which means you don't wear yourself out. Fascinating First Nations art, great store and the little cafe was fabulous. Good for all ages!

One visit isn't enough. The building itself is beautiful and there are so many interesting works in this museum. The UBC students are so lucky to come whenever they want for free! I especially enjoyed the first nations exhibits, but the artifacts from other cultures around the world were also beautiful. The juxtaposition of contemporary works with more historical pieces helped to mix things up and avoid information overload from any one time period or place.

The Museum of Anthropology, located on the gorgeous grounds of the University of British Columbia, was a good experience.

Tours may be taken as part of the admission fee. There are wood carvings throughout, including story poles/totem poles on display in various stages of aging. There is a native textile display, and a substantial collection of artifacts from other cultures.

The outdoor grounds and trails are also a great addition to the experience.

There is a snack bar present with various hot drinks and a small selection of sandwiches.

No free parking here. There is a surface lot down the street or a covered parking garage across the street on UBC campus.

Great little museum - kept our girls (3.5, 1) interested for an hour or so. Lots of masks and indigenous art. Interesting Kent Monkman
Exhibit when we went. Relaxed and family friendly: COVID timed-entry meant we were pretty much to ourselves.
Cafe an excellent space to take a short break before heading on.

This facility located on the edge of the University of British Columbia has an absolutely incredible collection of material from First Nation People of the Northwest Coast of British Columbia. If you have interest in history and culture this facility is a must when visiting Vancouver. I would allow an afternoon to visit an absorb the amzing collection at this museum.

Staff was rude and dismissive. No one on the floor keeping the bigger kids from messing with smaller kids or breaking rules etc. There are good things about this facility - but they are heavily over-shadowed by how poorly it is run.

Bring a thermos. They have a water bottle vending machine and no fountain on site so as to prompt you to spend money on bottled water. Won't find us here spending our money again unless there are some major changes in staff training and company policies towards how to treat customers and their children.

I called in advance to make sure of things.  I was told that there was less than an hour left and I would still be charged for a full hour.  I told them I was fine with this, and asked of anything else.   They told me that cash was not optional, so make sure I used something other than it.  I said sure thing!  And headed there as fast as I could.   When I got there I was told that I did not have the right payment method because I was using contactless payment.  I told them this was what I was directed towards and they said there was nothing they could do.   I asked to speak to the manager,  but they were no where to be found.  The employee said that they would accept cash, or debit, but they wouldn’t accept payment via phone.   I pleaded with them, as there was now only half an hour of jump time left.  I told them if I liked the experience I would bring a friend and come again, repeatedly, as I only lived ten minutes away.  They still said no.  I let them know that their practice was bad business and that I would leave an indicative rating.  This place could be good, if it had better staff.  I hope people can have the opportunity

Had a great time here with my family. Good Covid protocols, took our temperatures when we arrived which I liked. Our favourite part was the glow in the dark lights - super fun! Recommend this place for some guaranteed family fun!
Due to covid-19..there were less trampolines available. Overall experience was good. But they should expand it more..
Very nice and helpful staff. Nice place to bring kids together.
Beautiful
Good view of Vancouver, a nice stop on the way up to/down from Cypress. Easily accessible, lots of parking and close to the city.
So beautiful! Pretty populated around sunset but the view was amazing
Lovely spot to look out over the city. Really just a parking lot and a rest stop. It's generally quiet, but does get crowded at peak times (e.g. weekend sunsets).

Great viewpoint to look at vancouver and it's downtown. Pretty busy especially at golden hour. but overall a nice and pleasant place to visit and a nice road to get you there as well. Mt Baker is visible as well on a clearer day.

What a beautiful place to enjoy nature!!
I really liked how quiet it is despite being crowdy!! Go on a weekday and you will find it empty so that you can take a lot of pictures. There is ‘love in the rain’ section in where people attach locks with their lovers name. Also this place has a lake, and really beautiful for walks with your loved ones.
A beautiful place❤️

Edit: went there again and it was just amazing, how beautiful this park is😍

Beautifully sculpted flower gardens - truly an oasis in the city. Grew up playing/rejuvenating here for over 50 years and still marvel at the variety of trees and plants. Excellent foresight to keep this park. Well used, as it should be. Waiting to see what's in that time capsule to be opened in 2054....

This former quarry has been transformed with a lot of thought and care into this tranquil haven. Acknowledgement should be given to former Park Board Deputy Superintendent Bill Livingstone who created this beautiful space for the city of Vancouver and it's visitors to enjoy.
I love the selection of plants that have been chosen, which compliment each other to beautifully and provide our rich tapestry of colours and textures for the eyes to feast on.

Be sure to check out the Conservatory while you are here.
Being on the highest point of Vancouver, there are great city views to be had from the top of thep park. There is also a restaurant which is open throughout the week.

This is a family friendly park to visit.  Plenty of parking, though we prefer to cycle - could do with more bike racks near the conservatory.  Lots of trauls to explore on foot.  There are a couple of naturalized areas which are a lot quieter.  Be careful, outside of the dog off-leash area, many dog owners don't put their did back on a leash.  Tennis courts always seem busy.  To avoid crowds, head to naturalized area by rose garden/pitch n putt, or to the duck pond area, away from the fantastic quarry gardens.

This place is so incredible. I cannot express enough how beautiful and serene this park is. Obviously the best time of year to go is in the summer time, during late July to early August. The landscaping in the botanical gardens is aesthetically pleasing and well maintained. The endless trails you can choose from to walk through the park make it the perfect place to go for a morning jog, a meditating walk or a first date. I have so many fond memories in Queen-E, it is a timeless tourist attraction and a local safe haven for anyone who appreciates flowers and nature. The best part is that it is FREE.
